entry.title: Lion Cub
entry.summary:
Author: batling_out_of_hell

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,243Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 167

Summary: Bruce finds baby Jon-El in a pod that crash landed in his backyard. The Justice League warns him that Kryptonians are not to be messed with, that they're incredibly powerful, that they're conquerors. That little baby Jon may be a toddler, but so was a lion cub.Bruce doesn't care. A baby is a baby, and Jon is his baby now.The one thing he didn't count on, however, was the lion returning.

entry.title: A Simple Request
entry.summary:
Author: bajuwa

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,413Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 22

Summary: “I have a… request I would like to make of you.”Clark’s brows instinctively furrow at his boyfriend’s uncharacteristic demeanor, but he does his best to stay calm and casual, not wanting to accidentally put Bruce on edge with his concern. If Clark has learned anything through his decade-long relationship with Batman—including only half a year as romantic partners, but who’s counting?—it’s that Batman is deeply allergic to concern.

entry.title: weak and powerless (over you)
entry.summary:
Author: byzantinedaydeams

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,773Chapters: 1/16Kudos: 9

Summary: Batman doesn’t trust Superman as far as he can throw him. As it turns out, with a little (a lot) of Kryptonite, that’s not very far. While Batman doesn’t normally compromise his rules, Bruce Wayne deals in gray areas. Compartmentalizing has its perks, and they taste like strawberry lip balm. Although it might seem like their common lifestyles as vigilantes make them a perfect match, as they get to know each other better, they each realize that there is more to the other than meets the eye.(Or: Clark gets a metric fuck-ton of Kryptonite stuck in his body and Bruce decides he’s allowed to break his unwritten “don’t kiss Clark” rule)

entry.title: Undressed Souls
entry.summary:
Author: Selmor_selmor

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,967Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 27

Summary: Clark Kent has spent his life loving Lois Lane with everything he has, but no matter how deep his feelings, it’s never enough. As he struggles to move on from the one person who ever made him feel human, his pain goes unnoticed—except by the quiet, observant eyes of Batman.Batman’s love is silent, subtle, and steadfast, while Superman’s love is bold, loud, and undeniable. Their contrasting ways of loving keep them apart, and Batman is forced to accept the harsh reality: in this universe, their love was never meant to be. Neither Superman’s loud passion nor Batman’s quiet devotion can fill the emptiness left by the one person their hearts ache for.

entry.summary:
Author: Samitus

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 47,638Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 428

Summary: Bruce Wayne wore many hats: CEO by day, playboy by night, Batman when needed, and full-time father.But with Batman on an unexpected break, Bruce finds himself stepping into the role of journalist when Superman requests exclusive interviews to earn the Dark Knight’s trust. After all, who better than Bruce—allegedly Batman's 'sugar daddy'—to introduce him to Dark Knight ?With his detective instincts kicking in, Bruce sees an opportunity to uncover Superman’s weaknesses. But interviewing an alien who seems to like everyone but him turns out to be his toughest challenge yet.

entry.title: Moot Deliberation
entry.summary:
Author: quack_says_the_sane_one

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 63,222Chapters: 55/?Kudos: 1,404

Summary: Clark Kent has been Superman for a while now, and the last thing he expected to happen in that time was for him to develop feelings for the cold and distant Batman. But when his day job thrusts him into acquaintance with the billionaire Bruce Wayne, Clark thinks this new attraction will make the perfect distraction from his coworker. That is, until Batman begins acting strangely, almost as if his crush wasn’t as unrequited as he’d thought...Bruce Wayne likes to keep a healthy work-life balance. That means no friendships with his coworkers, especially not Mr. Goody Two-Shoes with his dark hair and his innocent act. And Bruce is positive it is an act - at least, until he runs into Mr. Goody Two-Shoes at a fundraiser, wearing jeans and a sweater instead of tights and a cape. But hey, Clark definitely doesn’t realize who he is, so maybe they can be friends outside of work. Superman doesn’t need to know his secret identity has been cracked; Bruce knows nothing if not how to keep a secret.

entry.title: The Buttered Cat Paradox
entry.summary:
Author: writersagainstwritersblock

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,948Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 269

Summary: “No comment.”“You don’t know what I was going to ask,” Clark said with a hint of a smile. “Maybe I just wanted to congratulate you on catching the Film Freak.”Bruce gave him a flat look.“Or maybe I think I can help.”“With a case of vandalism?”Clark stepped in front of him. “It’s not vandalism and you know it, detective.”“And what makes you say that?”“If it were vandalism it would be something a lot more juvenile. To the point. It wouldn’t claim there were seventeen missing kids. That’s public outcry.”“Is that so?”“That and I tried to do a story on the growing number of homeless children last month and I got shut down. According to the last count, the numbers have been decreasing, but there’s been no change in policies, no extra funding to CPS, or shelters, or even an increase in the number of inmates in the juvenile detention center. So where are they going?” Detective Bruce Wayne may have the highest solve rate in Gotham, but if he wants to solve this case, he’ll need the help of an elusive street kid, and while Dick Grayson always lands on his feet, he usually lands himself right into trouble.

entry.title: Bad Influence
entry.summary:
Author: mustangisinflames

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,057Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 19

Summary: Batman opened his hand, splayed his fingers, metal claws catching moonlight with a flash, reflecting bright in reddened eyes at his feet. Criminals learned by example. Lessons needed to be taught, driven in hard if they had any chance of sticking. They needed to be shown what their choices led to, and what they led to was vengeance.‘Did you at least consider that he might be desperate? That he doesn’t want to sell drugs but has to?’Batman grit his teeth hard enough to grind at the thought of him. Olive coloured skin and dark blue eyes, black hair hanging in his face, half drowned by rain. A ridiculously bright suit that had as much of a place in Gotham as the alien wearing it did.Superman. Turns out Superman can have an influence even if he isn't there. Batman isn't pleased about it.

  • i swear it’s not as depressing as it seems

entry.title: Shadows of Wayne: A Dark Reflection
entry.summary:
Author: theyfwmotherraven

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 982Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 45

Summary: In a world where Batman is dead, his children carry on the legacy in the shadows. When they kidnap an alternate Bruce Wayne who never donned the cape, they find a man more open, more trusting, and a far better father.
